study_schema.json.title: MINSEQE study schema
study_schema.json.description:
JSON-schema representing a study in MINSEQE. A planned activity that consists on study planning, study design execution,  documentation and which produces conclusion(s). Provenance: http://fged.org/site_media/pdf/MINSEQE_draft_2008.pdf, Section 5. General information about the experiment
amespace General information about the overall study must be given. This includes a summary of the experiment and its goals, contact information, and any associated publication.

identifier.description: Primary identifier for the study or experiment.

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for creating and maintaining the identifier.

title.description: A short sentence naming the study.

description.description: A textual narrative comprised of one or more statements about the study.

studyDesign.description: A textual description of the design of the experiment, indicating predictor variables, response variables, blocking variables if any.

studyType.description: The type of study, its goals and objective

contacts.description: The person(s) which contributed to the study, such as the Principal Investigator/corresponding author in publications or other researchers involved.

factors.description: Set of properties that in combination describe the experiment or experiments in the study.

publications.description: Scholarly articles associated with the investigation, usually describing the methods applied and conclusions reached by the investigation.

acknowledges.description: The grant(s) which funded and supported the investigation.

conclusions.description: A set of statements summarizing the findings of the study. It could be a URI referring to a nanopublication.

MINSEQEversion.description: The version of MINSEQE this dataset description should be compliant with.

MINSEQEcompliance.description: The result of the validation for MINSEQE compliance.

person_schema.json.title: MINSEQE person schema. A human being.
person_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing a person in MINSEQE

identifier.description: A persistent identifier of the person, it should be an ORCID.

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for creating and maintaining the identifier.

affiliation.description: The organizations to which the person is associated with.

roles.description: The roles assumed by the person. Ideally from a controlled vocabulary or ontology.

organization_schema.json.title: MINSEQE organization schema
organization_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing an organization in MINSEQE. Legal or physical entity corresponding to a business or administration

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for minting the identifier.

protocol_schema.json.title: MINSEQE Protocol schema
protocol_schema.json.description: The details about a Protocol for material acquisition, material transformation, data acquisition or data transformation

name.description: a short name for the protocol

protocol_uri.description: a web address to the protocol

protocol_description.description: a textual description of the protocol, with its various steps, a list of reagents, a list of instruments, a list of software used

protocol_type.description: the main purpose or main objective of the protocol, for instance 'mRNA extraction' or 'principal component analysis'

parameters.description: a list of variables which may be adjusted by the operation when applying the protocol. for instance, 'chromatography column'

parameter_schema.json.title: MINSEQE Parameter schema
parameter_schema.json.description: The details about a parameter defined by a protocol (e.g. an incubation temperature or a reagent concentration)

name.description: a short name for the parameter

factor_schema.json.title: MINSEQE factor schema
factor_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing a factor used in studies using sequencing to produce data according to MINSEQE requirements.

factor.description: An independent variable, defined by experimentalist in observation or intervention study.

factorValues.description: The set of values that the factor will assume.

value.description: A specific value assumed by the factor.

unit.description: The unit for the factor value.

annotation_schema.json.title: DATS annotation schema
annotation_schema.json.description: A pair of value (string or numeric) with a corresponding ontology term (IRI), if applicable.

value.description: The value of the annotation - it can be a string or a number (for coded values).

valueIRI.description: The IRI of a concept or ontology term associated with the value. It can also be an empty string

assay_schema.json.title: MINSEQE assay schema
assay_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing a sequencing assay requirements as specified by MINSEQE section 4 of http://fged.org/site_media/pdf/MINSEQE_draft_2008.pdf

sample_input.description: the biological material or library used as input to the sequencing assay

library_source.description: The LIBRARY_SOURCE specifies the type of source material that is being sequenced. (from SRA xml schema https://github.com/enasequence/schema/blob/master/src/main/resources/uk/ac/ebi/ena/sra/schema/SRA.experiment.xsd)

library_layout.description: The library layout (from SRA xml schema https://github.com/enasequence/schema/blob/master/src/main/resources/uk/ac/ebi/ena/sra/schema/SRA.experiment.xsd)

library_strategy.description: Sequencing technique intended for this library. (from SRA xml schema https://github.com/enasequence/schema/blob/master/src/main/resources/uk/ac/ebi/ena/sra/schema/SRA.experiment.xsd)

library_selection.description: Method used to enrich the target in the sequence library preparation. (from SRA xml schema https://github.com/enasequence/schema/blob/master/src/main/resources/uk/ac/ebi/ena/sra/schema/SRA.experiment.xsd

targeted_locus.description: The name of the gene specifically targeted during the library preparation step, typically during an environmental gene survey

probeset.description: The details about the pcr primers or probes used to target a specific genomic locus. it can be either a reference to a database identifier (typically probesetDB) or the actually probe sequence)

sequencing_platform.description: the sequencing type and instrument used for that assay

data_output.description: the sequence dataset resulting from the sequencing assay on the input material(s)

sample_schema.json.title: MINSEQE sample schema
sample_schema.json.description: Biological Sample description compliant with MINSEQE requirements as described in Section 1 of MINSEQE specifications, http://fged.org/site_media/pdf/MINSEQE_draft_2008.pdf

name.description: a short name or handle for the biological sample.

sample_description.description: A textual description of the biological sample

taxonomic_information.description: The source organism for this biological sample

antibodies.description: MINSEQE requirements, as evidenced from the statement found in sectoin 1 on MINSEQE document: 'Essential sample annotation, including the experimental factors and their values must be given. Experimental factors are the key experimental variables, for instance 'time' in a time series experiment or 'antibody' in a ChIP-Seq experiment

factor_values.description: the factor levels for the relevant factors associated with this particular sample

identifier.description: The identifier of the taxonomic information.

name.description: The scientific name of an organism.

extraProperties.description: Extra properties that do not fit in the previous specified attributes.

identifier.description: A code uniquely identifying an entity locally to a system or globally.

identifierSource.description: The identifier source represents information about the organisation/namespace responsible for minting the identifiers. It must be provided if the identifier is provided.

alternate_identifier_info_schema.json.title: DATS alternate identifier information schema
alternate_identifier_info_schema.json.description: Information about an alternate identifier (other than the primary).

identifier.description: An identifier or identifiers other than the primary Identifier applied to the resource being registered. (definition from DataCite)

identifierSource.description: The identifier source represents information about the organisation/namespace responsible for minting the identifiers. It must be provided if the identifier is provided.

related_identifier_info_schema.json.title: DATS related identifier information schema
related_identifier_info_schema.json.description: Information about an idenfier of related resources.

identifier.description: An identifier of a related resource.

identifierSource.description: The identifier source represents information about the organisation/namespace responsible for minting the identifiers. It must be provided if the identifier is provided.

relationType.description: The type of the relationship corresponding to this identifier.

category_values_pair_schema.json.title: DATS extension mechanism
category_values_pair_schema.json.description: Extension mechanism for DATS, which allows to add extra properties to the entities. It should be used only for cases where there are no specific properties to deal with the desired property.

category.description: A characteristic or property about the entity this object is associated with.

categoryIRI.description: The IRI corresponding to the category, if associated with an ontology term.

values.description: A set of (annotated) values associated with the cateogory.

oligo_probe_schema.json.title: MINSEQE oligo probe schema
oligo_probe_schema.json.description: The details about a oligonucleotide probe used during a library construction step, e.g. in the context of a targeted gene survey

name.description: a short name for the probeset

probe_type.description: the nature of the probe used to amplify a genomic locus during the library construction

probe_sequence.description: the nucleic acid sequence of the probe

sequencing_instrument_schema.json.title: MINSEQE sequencing instrument schema
sequencing_instrument_schema.json.description: The following details shall be specified about instruments used to sequence the biological materials.

platform.description: The instrument manufacturer shall be specified by stating its name (e.g. Illumina, Oxford Nanopore, 454, Ion Torrent). A URL pointing to manufacturer web pages may also be provided.

model.description: The instrument model shall be specified

other.description: Additional relevant instrument details should be provided and may include machine-specific information such as information about automated agitation, temperature control, controlled volume dispensing, sampling from microtiter plates, auto-boost, auto-flush, etc. Other custom settings shall be provided if relevant and may include setting name, description, and value.

sequencing_datafile_schema.json.title: MINSEQE datafile schema
sequencing_datafile_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing an investigation using sequencing technique according to MINSEQE requirements, as described in section 2 of http://fged.org/site_media/pdf/MINSEQE_draft_2008.pdf

date_info_schema.json.title: DATS date information schema.
date_info_schema.json.description: Information about a calendar date or timestamp indicating day, month, year and time of an event.

date.description: A date following the ISO8601 standard.

type.description: The type of date, used to specify the process which is being timestamped by the date attribute value, ideally comes from a controlled terminology.

identifier.description: A persistent identifier for the publication, it should be a DOI or pubmed identifier

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for minting the identifier.

publicationVenue.description: The venue where the publication appears (journal, publishing platform etc).

fund_schema.json.title: MINSEQE fund schema
fund_schema.json.description: Allocated funds given by a government or an organization for a particular research purpose.

name.description: The name of the grant and its funding program.

funds.description: The study or investigation supported by the grant.

funders.description: The person(s) or organization(s) which has awarded the funds supporting the project.

awardees.description: The person(s) or organization(s) which received the funds supporting the project.

dates.description: Relevant dates, such as the date when the grant was awarded, may be provided.

extraProperties.description: Extra properties that do not fit in the previous specified attributes.

investigation_schema.json.title: MINSEQE investigation schema
investigation_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing an investigation using sequencing techniques. A planned activity that involves one or more studies.

identifier.description: Primary identifier for the investigation. Ideally, a persistent identifier but an internal user identifier at a minimum.

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for creating and maintaining the identifier.

description.description: A textual narrative comprised of one or more statements about the investigation.

contacts.description: The person(s) who contributed to the investigation, such as the Principal Investigator, corresponding author in related publications or other researchers involved.

studies.description: The studies associated with the Investigation.

publications.description: Scholarly articles associated with the investigation, usually describing the methods applied and conclusions reached by the investigation.

acknowledges.description: The grant(s) which funded and supported the investigation.

conclusions.description: A set of statements summarizing the findings of the investigation. It could be a URI referring to a nanopublication.

MINSEQEversion.description: The version of MINSEQE this dataset description should be compliant with.

MINSEQEcompliance.description: The result of the validation for MINSEQE compliance.

investigation_schema.json.title: MIACME investigation schema
investigation_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing an investigation in MIACME. A planned activity that involves one or more studies.

identifier.description: Primary identifier for the investigation. Ideally, a persistent identifier but an internal user identifier at a minimum.

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for creating and maintaining the identifier.

description.description: A textual narrative comprised of one or more statements about the investigation.

contacts.description: The person(s) who contributed to the investigation, such as the Principal Investigator, corresponding author in related publications or other researchers involved.

studies.description: The studies associated with the Investigation.

publications.description: Scholarly articles associated with the investigation, usually describing the methods applied and conclusions reached by the investigation.

acknowledges.description: The grant(s) which funded and supported the investigation.

conclusions.description: A set of statements summarizing the findings of the investigation. It could be a URI referring to a nanopublication.

MIACMEversion.description: The version of MIACME this dataset description should be compliant with.

MIACMEcompliance.description: The result of the validation for MIACME compliance.

person_schema.json.title: MIACME person schema. A human being.
person_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing a person in MIACME

identifier.description: A persistent identifier of the person, it should be an ORCID.

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for creating and maintaining the identifier.

affiliation.description: The organizations to which the person is associated with.

roles.description: The roles assumed by the person. Ideally from a controlled vocabulary or ontology.

organization_schema.json.title: MIACME organization schema
organization_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing an organization in MIACME. Legal or physical entity corresponding to a business or administration

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for minting the identifier.

study_schema.json.title: MIACME study schema
study_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing a study in MIACME. A planned activity that consists on study planning, study design execution,  documentation and which produces conclusion(s).

identifier.description: Primary identifier for the study or experiment.

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for creating and maintaining the identifier.

title.description: A short sentence naming the study.

description.description: A textual narrative comprised of one or more statements about the study.

contacts.description: The person(s) which contributed to the study, such as the Principal Investigator/corresponding author in publications or other researchers involved.

experimental_setup.description: Set of properties that in combination describe the experiment or experiments in the study.

data.description: The data generated in this study.

publications.description: Scholarly articles associated with the investigation, usually describing the methods applied and conclusions reached by the investigation.

acknowledges.description: The grant(s) which funded and supported the investigation.

conclusions.description: A set of statements summarizing the findings of the study. It could be a URI referring to a nanopublication.

MIACMEversion.description: The version of MIACME this dataset description should be compliant with.

MIACMEcompliance.description: The result of the validation for MIACME compliance.

experimental_setup_schema.json.title: MIACME experimental setup schema
experimental_setup_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing the experimental setup in a cell migration experiment.

basicApproach.description: A description of the study type or approach used, such as in vitro, in vivo, in silico.

cellModel.description: A description of the cells used in the experiment.

assay.description: The migration/invasion assay for this investigation, and its specifications.

treatment.description: The manipulation/perturbation of which the (migratory) effect is being tested.

microEnvironment.description: The nature or components of the material surrounding/contacting the cells for which migration is tested, including substrate, ECM protein or synthetic counterpart, tissue, other cells or entire organism.

organism.description: The organism corresponding to the microEnvironment, if it is a tissue.

medium.description: Solution used to provide nutritives and motility-assisting additives to migrating cells

cell_model_schema.json.title: MIACME cell model schema
cell_model_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing the cell model in a cell migration experiment.

cellType.description: The type of cell used in the experiment. For example: cell line, primary cell, endogenous cell.

specificCellDetails.description: The specific details about the cell.

organism.description: The organism of origin of the cell.

assay_schema.json.title: MIACME assay schema
assay_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing the cell model in a cell migration experiment.

cellInput.description: The manner in which the cell population is presented at the start of the assay

imaging_condition_schema.json.title: MIACME imaging condition schema
imaging_condition_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing an investigation in MIACME

modality.description: The type of microscopy used to acquire images. For example: confocal, microscopy, spinning disk, wide-field, multi-phonon, light-sheet, super-resolution,

imageSequenceType.description: Single or multiple imaging timepoints in the experiment.

observationPeriod.description: For time-series, it is the timespan since the imaging process starts until it ends. For endpoint, it is the timespan since the starting point until the image is taken.

observationPeriodUnit.description: The unit of the observation period.

timeSeriesInterval.description: The duration between two sequential frames of the time lapse series.

timeSeriesIntervalUnit.description: The unit of the time series interval.

channelDefinition.description: Identification of the label or constrasts

pixels.description: The physical dimension of one picture element in your image.

objectiveLens.description: Objective manufacturer and objective acronym specifying optical correction, primary use of microscopy method and magnification (may also include immersion medium and/or working distance or field of view)

numericalAperture.description:
Value that indicates the light acceptance angle of the objective (
determines the light gathering power, resolving power, and depth of 
field of the objective).

pixel_schema.json.title: MIACME pixel schema. A picture element. Based on OME Pixel: https://www.openmicroscopy.org/Schemas/Documentation/Generated/OME-2016-06/ome_xsd.html#Pixels
pixel_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing a pixel in MIACME

identifier.description: An identifier for the picture element.

sizeX.description: The range one picture element in the image spans in the width dimension.

sizeY.description: The range one picture element in the image spans in the height dimension.

sizeZ.description: The range one picture element in the image spans in the depth dimension.

sizeC.description: The number of channels of the picture element.

physicalSizeX.description: The physical size of the pixel in the width dimension.

physicalSizeXUnit.description: The unit of the physical size of the pixel in the width dimension.

physicalSizeY.description: The physical size of the pixel in the height dimension.

physicalSizeYUnit.description: The unit of the physical size of the pixel in the height dimension.

physicalSizeZ.description: The physical size of the pixel in the depth dimension.

physicalSizeZUnit.description: The unit of the physical size of the pixel in the depth dimension.

data_schema.json.title: MIACME data schema
data_schema.json.description: JSON-schema representing an investigation in MIACME

date_schema.json.title: MIACME date schema
date_schema.json.description: Information about a calendar date or timestamp indicating day, month, year and time of an event.

date.description: A date following the ISO8601 standard.

type.description: The type of date, used to specify the process which is being timestamped by the date attribute value, ideally comes from a controlled terminology.

annotation_schema.json.title: MIACME annotation schema
annotation_schema.json.description: A pair of value (string or numeric) with a corresponding ontology term (IRI), if applicable.

value.description: The value of the annotation - it can be a string or a number (for coded values).

valueIRI.description: The IRI of a concept or ontology term associated with the value. It can also be an empty string

identifier.description: A persistent identifier for the publication, it should be a DOI or pubmed identifier

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for minting the identifier.

publicationVenue.description: The venue where the publication appears (journal, publishing platform etc).

grant_schema.json.title: MIACME grant schema
grant_schema.json.description: An allocated sum of funds given by a government or other organization for a particular purpose.

identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation or namespace responsible for creating and maintaining the identifier.

name.description: The name of the grant and its funding program.

funders.description: The person(s) or organization(s) which has awarded the funds supporting the project.
